page.title: 20EDUCATION.
page.content: 1We spent an afternoon at Playgroup in the Institute,organised by a group of parents.They have toys including a climbing frame,prams,dolls,jigsaws, cars, and many more.The children are aged 3-5 years.They also use paint, glue and play dough.The four year olds went to Mrs.Martin's reading group,an important feature as there is no Nursery provision in Roos.The children enjoyed dressing up and Richard Hoe and Stacey Sedgwick did a puppet show for them.Whilst the mothers tidied up the children had story time,then they all had a drink(orange or milk),and a biscuit.After this they made gardens out of crepe paper and egg boxes,and some of the children made shapes with the playdough.They finished with a story.
